intro: Piptocarpha richteri, commonly known as the desert gum plant, is a flowering shrub native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in dry environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Piptocarpha richteri is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to harsh, semi-arid climates.
